title: Cybercheck Communications and Contracts

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents since Jan. 1, 2021 between Pueblo County Sheriff's Office and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2. All email exchanges, including attachments, between Pueblo County Sheriff's Office staff and email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai" between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

3. All emails, including attachments, between staff of Pueblo County Sheriff's Office that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

I kindly request that you waive all fees as I am a journalist and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest.

If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request.

If you choose to reject this request or redact portions of responsive documents, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Hatcher

title: Immigration Judge Zol Rainey"All Remands from Board of Immigration Appeals"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Immigration Judge Zol Rainey"All Remands from Board of Immigration Appeals"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The decisions issued by the Board of Immigration Appeals from December 2021 until the date of processing of this request, arising from cases decided by Immigration Judge Zol Damon Rainey, that were administratively closed, reversed, background check remand, and/or remand (including remands to a different IJ).

I would request any printouts, summaries, spreadsheets, reports, or other records or datasets that may encompass or address how many of removal orders included a negative credibility determination for any Respondent(s) for whom IJ Rainey issued removal orders in protection/form I-589 cases (in other words, decisions on Asylum, Wittholding of Removal, or Relief under the Convention Against Torture), after merits/individual hearings occurred, between December 2021 and the date of processing of this request.

All correspondence or communications in any medium (including but not limited to any email, fax, letter, text/SMS/MMS, memorandum, voicemail, audio recording, sticky-note, or any attachment thereto, and any conversion of any of the foregoing from a digital to analog form/format, or vice-versa) to or from IJ Rainey, from December 2021 through present time, regarding removal or any other immigration proceedings, containing the words "credibility," "credible," "incredible," "incoherent," "demeanor," "candor," "evasive," "non-responsive," "responsiveness," "inconsistent," "consistent," "consistency," "facial expression(s)," "body language," "standard language," or "addendum of law," or any abbreviation, contraction, misspelling, pluralization, or paraphrase thereof.

Copies of each and every "standard language addendum of law" or any substantially similar 'boilerplate' or 'template' document utilized by IJ Rainey as an exhibit in, as an attachment to, or as a drafting aid for any merits decision in a protection/form I-589 matter.

The requested records will be made available to the general public via a FOIA records clearinghouse, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes; rather, the results will be disseminated to interested individuals free of charge, and with no pecuniary gain to the Requestor, who is not the subject of any of these records. Thus, we would request that fees be waived.

Please search all records regarding agency business. You may not exclude searches of files or emails in the personal custody of your officials, such as personal email accounts. Records of official business conducted using unofficial systems or stored outside of official files is subject to the Federal Records Act and FOIA. It is not adequate to rely on policies and procedures that require officials to move such information to official systems within a certain period of time; I exercise and specifically preserve and assert my right to records contained in those files even if material has not yet been moved to official systems or if officials have, through negligence or willfulness, failed to meet their obligations.

If it is your position that any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, I request that you provide an index of those documents as required under Vaughn v. Rosen, describe each document claimed as exempt with sufficient specificity to determine whether it should be exempt under FOIA, and discuss the consequences of disclosing, specifically identifying the reasons why a particular exemption is relevant and correlating those claims with the particular part of a withheld document to which they apply.

If it is your position that a record contains non-exempt segments, but that those non-exempt segments are so dispersed throughout the document as to make segregation impossible, please state what portion of the document is non-exempt, and how the material is dispersed throughout the document. If a request is denied in whole, please state specifically that it is not reasonable to segregate portions of the record for release.

You should institute a preservation hold on information responsive to this request. I intend to pursue all legal avenues to enforce my right of access under the FOIA, including litigation if that becomes necessary. Accordingly, the EOIR is on notice that litigation is reasonably foreseeable.

If it will accelerate release of responsive records to me, please also provide responsive material on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely yours,

Derrick J. Hensley

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Derrick Hensley

title: Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FOIA Request to the Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
📌 Address:
Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
450 Columbus Blvd, Suite 2
Hartford, CT 06103


📌 Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request – Expedited Processing & ADA Accommodations Requested

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-200, et seq.), I request expedited processing and ADA accommodations for the following records:

Records Requested:
All records, communications, and case files related to CHRO Case #2510183, including but not limited to:

Internal communications between CHRO officials discussing this case.
Communications between CHRO and the Connecticut Office of the Attorney General.
Communications between CHRO and the Connecticut Department of Consumer Protection (DCP) regarding this case.
Any records related to ADA enforcement actions, decisions, or internal deliberations about CHRO Case #2510183.
All emails, memos, and written correspondence from January 1, 2024, to present discussing:

ADA Title II enforcement and compliance within CHRO investigations.
Whistleblower complaints related to disability rights enforcement.
Denials of accommodations for individuals with disabilities within CHRO’s jurisdiction.
All policies, procedures, or internal guidance used by CHRO when handling ADA complaints, disability discrimination cases, or whistleblower retaliation claims involving state agencies.

Any CHRO reports, memos, or correspondence sent to federal oversight agencies (DOJ, HHS OCR, EEOC) regarding ADA violations or CHRO Case #2510183.

Request for Expedited Processing:
I request expedited processing under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d) due to:

The urgent public interest in ensuring CHRO is properly enforcing ADA protections.
Ongoing legal proceedings in CHRO Case #2510183, where delays in obtaining this information could impact my ability to seek justice.
Evidence of government suppression of civil rights enforcement and whistleblower retaliation, necessitating immediate federal review.
Please confirm expedited processing and provide an estimated date for the production of these records.

Request for ADA Accommodations:
As a person with a disability protected under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, I require the following non-negotiable accommodations:
✅ Electronic Only Communication – All records and responses must be provided in the body of the message and as PDF attachments. No physical mail or portal logins are permitted.
✅ Simplified Summaries for Complex Records – Any highly technical or complex documents must include a plain-language summary to ensure accessibility.
✅ Identification of Responsible Personnel – The names, titles, and contact information of the individuals handling this request must be provided.
✅ Detailed Justifications for Redactions or Denials – If any records are withheld, I require a full legal explanation under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(b), with specific statutory citations.

If any accommodation is denied, please provide a written explanation and cite the specific legal basis for non-compliance under ADA Title II (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and Section 504 (29 U.S.C. § 794).

Delivery Format:
I request that the records be provided in electronic format to ensure accessibility. If this request is denied in whole or in part, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide an index of withheld documents.

Please confirm receipt of this request within four business days and provide an estimated timeline for completion.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros 
ABI Resources

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-200, et seq.), I request expedited processing and ADA accommodations for the following records:

Records Requested:
All communications, emails, memos, and internal correspondence from January 1, 2024, to present between:
Rebecca Quinn, Assistant Attorney General
William Tong, Attorney General of Connecticut
Paulette G. Annon, Assistant Legal Director, Connecticut DCP
Julianne Avallone, Chief Legal Officer, Connecticut DCP
Cassandra Bretones, Human Rights Attorney, CHRO
…that discuss:

CHRO Case #2510183
ADA Title II compliance and enforcement
Whistleblower complaints related to disability rights enforcement
All records related to the Connecticut Attorney General’s Office’s involvement in CHRO Case #2510183, including but not limited to:

Legal arguments, filings, or motions made on behalf of Connecticut DCP.

Request for Expedited Processing:
I am requesting expedited processing under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d) due to:

The urgent public interest in Connecticut’s enforcement (or lack thereof) of federal disability rights laws affecting individuals statewide.
Ongoing legal proceedings in CHRO Case #2510183, where delays in obtaining this information could impact my ability to seek justice.
Evidence of ongoing retaliation and suppression of civil rights enforcement, necessitating urgent federal review.
Please confirm expedited processing and provide an estimated date for the production of these records.

Request for ADA Accommodations:
As a person with a disability protected under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, I require the following non-negotiable accommodations:
✅ Electronic Only Communication – All records and responses must be provided in the body of the message and as PDF attachments. No physical mail or portal logins are permitted.
✅ Simplified Summaries for Complex Records – Any highly technical or complex documents must include a plain-language summary to ensure accessibility.
✅ Identification of Responsible Personnel – The names, titles, and contact information of the individuals handling this request must be provided.
✅ Detailed Justifications for Redactions or Denials – If any records are withheld, I require a full legal explanation under Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(b), with specific statutory citations.

If any accommodation is denied, please provide a written explanation and cite the specific legal basis for non-compliance under ADA Title II (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and Section 504 (29 U.S.C. § 794).

Delivery Format:
I request that the records be provided in electronic format to ensure accessibility. If this request is denied in whole or in part, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide an index of withheld documents.

Please confirm receipt of this request within four business days and provide an estimated timeline for completion.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros 
ABI Resources

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

Incident Summary: Seawright was arrested after threatening a store manager and providing a false name and date of birth to officers. Seawright was found to have five outstanding arrest warrants from multiple law enforcement agencies. She was then transported to Lowndes County Jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident Involving Band Director at Jackson-Olin High School

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident Involving Band Director at Jackson-Olin High School
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the incident that occurred on September 14 involving the band director at Minor High School in Birmingham, Alabama.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: September 14
Location: Jackson-Olin High School football field, Birmingham, Alabama
Suspect: director at Minor High School
Incident Summary: Following the end of a football game between Jackson-Olin High School and Minor High School, the Minor High School band continued playing music for at least 18 minutes after the game concluded. The band director was confronted by police officers after refusing to stop the performance. Bodycam footage shows the band director arguing with officers and telling them to "get out of my face," before being restrained and tasered. The director was later treated at the scene and transported to a local hospital. He was charged with disorderly conduct, harassment, and resisting arrest.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the incident at Jackson-Olin High School, including any footage that shows the interaction between the band director and police officers, as well as any subsequent actions leading to his arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident Involving Carla Jefferson (Pinellas County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident Involving Carla Jefferson (Pinellas County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the arrest of Carla Jefferson for repeated misuse of the 911 system.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Location: St. Petersburg, Florida
Suspect: Carla Jefferson, 51
Incident Summary: Jefferson was arrested after making over 12,512 phone calls to the St. Petersburg Police Department and Pinellas County Sheriff’s Office, accounting for approximately 10% of all incoming calls. Her calls were described as vulgar, threatening, and obscene, often holding up emergency lines. After receiving a notice of prosecution, Jefferson called the precinct demanding to be arrested but later refused to answer the door when officers arrived. She was charged with three misdemeanors related to misuse of the 911 system and harassing phone calls.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to Jefferson’s arrest, including footage of any interactions at her residence.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun
